SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Cache More Types of Storefront Data

Enjoy improved performance when pricing entitled products, populating the wish list selector component, and querying for items in the shopping cart. B2B Commerce for Visualforce can now cache this data in your org's Platform Cache partition.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: After you upgrade the available global data, the following configuration settings are available under the Platform Cache module:

Account Group Price Lists Cache TTL
Cart Items Cache TTL
Wishlists Cache TTL

To begin caching this data, allocate space to the platform cache partition that B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides, if you haven't already done so. Then, using the new configuration settings, enter a time to live (TTL) for each type of cached data.

The following API updates support this change. To customize the default caching behavior, create subscriber code that extends the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API.

DATA	EXTENSION POINT
Account group price lists	ccrz.ccLogicPIEntLists.fetchAccountGroupPriceListIDs()
Cart items	ccrz.ccApiCart.fetchCartItems()
Wish lists	ccrz.ccApiWishList.fetch()
SEE ALSO
Improve Storefront Performance with Platform Cache
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccApiCart
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccApiWishList
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccLogicPLEntLists
